user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_post_process:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_post_process (struct MHD_PostProcessor *pp,
                  const char *post_data,
                  size_t post_data_len)
{
  if (0 == post_data_len)
    return MHD_YES;
  if (NULL == pp)
    return MHD_NO;
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ (MHD_HTTP_POST_ENCODING_FORM_URLENCODED,
                                 pp->encoding,
                                 MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (
                                   MHD_HTTP_POST_ENCODING_FORM_URLENCODED)))
    return post_process_urlencoded (pp,
                                    post_data,
                                    post_data_len);
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ (MHD_HTTP_POST_ENCODING_MULTIPART_FORMDATA,
                                 pp->encoding,
                                 MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (
                                   MHD_HTTP_POST_ENCODING_MULTIPART_FORMDATA)))
    return post_process_multipart (pp,
                                   post_data,
                                   post_data_len);
  /* this should never be reached */
  return MHD_NO;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
/* this should never be reached */
  return MHD_NO;
explanation: The other code fragments do not indicate unreachable code and therefore need not be investigated for Rule 2.1: the early "if (0 == post_data_len) return MHD_YES;" is an intentional early-exit when there is no data; the "if (NULL == pp) return MHD_NO;" is a normal null-pointer guard; the function signature and surrounding braces are structural and not related to reachability. The only potential reachability concern is that the function assumes pp->encoding will match one of the two handled encodings—so the two encoding-check branches and the final "this should never be reached" fallback return should be investigated.
